sentences: Ma ostsin väikese lapse jaoks mängu.
See on väike koer, aga ta on armas.
context: "Väikese" is the illative case singular form of the Estonian adjective "väike", meaning "small" or "little". The illative case typically indicates motion into a place, but it can also be used for certain grammatical constructions including with certain prepositions or in possessive constructions where English would use "of a small..." or "with a small...". In the examples provided, it shows different ways this form might appear in context.
